PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask., where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our Province.

Name: Oliver Wilson
Address: 123 Main St., Saskatoon
Birthplace: England

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1903
Where did you set up housekeeping? Saskatoon
Where had you been living before that? England, Willoughby, Lancashire
For how many people did you prepare meals? 5
How far was it to your nearest store? 9 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once a week
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Tea, Sugar, Flour, Dried fruits, sometimes Jam

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Badger
In what quantities did you buy it? Six Bags of 50 lbs each
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.50
How much did you use graham flour?
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? Yes
How far away? 20 miles
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $1.75
What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal, Whole Wheat, Farina
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it?
